intro: Fagonia cretica var. californica, commonly known as California fagonia, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellowish-green leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. It has a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert and coastal ecosystems.
